meanings.definition: A secondary or informal name used to describe or identify a person.
meanings.sent1: My friend has a funny byname that everyone calls him at school.
meanings.sent2: The famous singer has a cool byname that fans use to refer to him.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't stop laughing when my teacher accidentally called me by my dog's byname.
meanings.sent4: Her byname 'Sunshine' perfectly reflects her cheerful personality.
meanings.sent5: The detective's mysterious byname 'Shadow' intrigued everyone in town.

meanings.definition: An additional name or title given to someone, especially as a nickname.
meanings.sent1: The superhero's byname 'Captain Courage' inspired many young children.
meanings.sent2: In the old days, knights often had a byname that represented their bravery.
meanings.sent3: My grandma's byname for me is 'Little Explorer' because I love to discover new things.
meanings.sent4: The wise elder's byname 'Sage' was earned through years of experience.
meanings.sent5: The pirate's byname 'Blackbeard' struck fear into the hearts of sailors.
